title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, December 7, 1868
summary: In an informal report to E. P. Smith, Scott comments on his continuing feud with the black pastor of the local Methodist church, complaining that "the ignorant minister with zeal not according to knowledge still keeps his noisy meetings over the heads of the night school."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
